column4: Ok.. now i am confused... first couple boots, i saw my amd64 dualcore as 2 cpus.. now it only shows 1, and /proc/cpuinfo shows the wrong mhz too
what kernel are you using?
generic, x86 32bit
isnt that a 64bit arch?
yes.. but thats not the point
what is it reading the type as?
that part is right.
dmesg |grep CPU0
what i dont get is what changed.. it used to get the right info and see both cpus
run top and see if when you press the number one... if it expands to see both CPUs
already did.. 1 cpu.. but
looks like cpu1 is gettin the wrong interrupt
is it a SMP kernel?
i believe so.. generic does smp on my other machines
is it enabled in your mobo BIOS?
i looked around, and didnt see anything that controls that... lemme reboot and look again
i figured it out
noapic acpi=noirq

ok.. will test that.. BUT.. heh, i unplugged a questionable usb cf reader.. and its got 2 cpus again..when i first tried to install, it was plugged in and caused the system to hang when the installer was starting
thats because your IRQ's are going bananas.
right
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=373534
